arm_group.description: Xyntha will be administered according to physician's discretion.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to describe the safety and efficacy of Xyntha® during the usual care setting.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post Marketing Surveillance To Observe Safety And Efficacy Of Xyntha® In Subjects With Hemophilia A

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients or legally authorized representatives of pediatric patients agree to provide
             written informed consent form (data privacy statement).

          -  Pediatric and adult patients who have been treated with Xyntha for Hemophilia A from
             first approved date by KFDA, or who are planned to be newly prescribed Xyntha.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with a known history of hypersensitivity to original or reformulated Xyntha
             or any component of the product.

          -  Patients with a known history of hypersensitivity to hamster protein.

          -  Patients participating in an interventional trial of any investigational drug or
             device.

intervention.description: Xyntha will be administered according to physician's discretion.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

facility.name: Kyung Hee University Hospital at Gangdong

clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance To Observe Safety And Efficacy Of Xyntha® In Subjects With Hemophilia A

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: The clinical nature, incidence, duration, and severity of adverse events; discontinuation due to adverse events; outcome and possible causality will be monitored at every visit in this study

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy endpoint: annualized bleeding rates (ABRs) and responses to the on-demand treatment with BeneFIX for all bleeds (4-point scale of assessment: excellent, good, moderate, no response)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Ecologic or Community, Time Perspective: Prospective
